description:
Loop: 8 km, Time: 2.5 hours
Trailhead: UTM; 10 U 0618114 e 5469379 n	WGS84
lat/long; N 49°21.938? W 121°22.369?
Pioneers used this route to transport supplies between the Interior and the Coast.  Great views overlook the Coquihalla River.  A plaque commemorating the trail is located at the top.
 There is GPS data attached to this trail (see "download GPS"), which if loaded into your GPS can help you find route points.
directions: Head east on Wallace St.  Turn right on Sixth Ave.  Cross the railway tracks and turn left on Kawkawa Lake Rd.  Bear right onto Othello Rd. and drive 3 km. Turn right onto Tunnels Rd. and park in the lot.  Walk through Othello Quintette Tunnels.  About 300 metres past the last tunnel is a sign on the right marking the trailhead.  The trail loops back to Tunnels Rd.
title: Nicola Valley Trail
